ms.ipp

Class Streams

  • java.lang.Object
    • ms.ipp.Streams

  • public class Streams
extends java.lang.Object
    This class comprises a collection of most-widely-used queries on Streams, such as finding the first element with given conditions (and automatically checking that the selected element is the only one with those conditions), checking if none, any or all elements satisfy a condition or re-packing elements into a different type of Collection.
    Author:
    mykhailo.saienko

      • unique

        public static <T> T unique(java.util.stream.Stream<T> st,
                           java.util.function.Predicate<? super T> pred)
        If there is exactly one item in the Iterable which satisfies a given Predicate, returns the element. If there are no items satisfying the Predicate, returns null. If there are more than one items, throws IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        st - the original stream, not null
        pred - the predicate. If null, the original stream is used
        Returns:

      • first

                          java.util.function.Predicate<? super T> pred)
        Returns the first element encountered in the stream which satisfies a given Predicate
        Parameters:
        st - the original stream, not null
        pred - the predicate, null is interpreted as a condition which always returns true
        Returns:

      • forEach

        public static <T> void forEach(java.util.stream.Stream<T> st,
                               java.util.function.Predicate<? super T> pred,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> proc)
        Performs a given action on all elements from the stream which satisfy a given Predicate.
        Parameters:
        st - the original stream, not null
        pred - the predicate. If null, the original stream is used
        proc - the action to perform on eligible elements, not null

      • collect

        public static <T,U extends T,R> R collect(java.util.stream.Stream<U> it,
                                          java.util.function.Predicate<? super U> pred,
                                          java.util.stream.Collector<T,?,R> collector)
        Collects all elements from the stream which satisfy a given Predicate by using a given Collector.
        Parameters:
        st - the original stream, not null
        pred - the predicate. If null, the original stream is used
        collector - the Collector, as it is used by @{code Stream::collect} methods

      • collect

        public static <T,U extends T,R> R collect(java.util.stream.Stream<U> st,
                                          java.util.function.Predicate<? super U> pred,
                                          java.util.stream.Collector<T,?,R> collector,
                                          int n)
        Collects at most the first n elements from the stream which satisfy a given Predicate by using a given Collector.
        Parameters:
        st - the original stream, not null
        pred - the predicate. If null, the original stream is used
        collector - the Collector, as it is used by @{code Stream::collect} methods.
        n - the number of elements to collect
